summary:
In 2006 I came to the Netherlands to work for TomTom in the Map testing team. The following 6 years I learned all about automated testing and project planning.
In my last role I was leading remotely located test teams.

In 2012 I made a switch to Fugro to follow my passion for Hydrography and Geology. At first the focus was still on software testing, since a year I work on the client side. In this role I am responsible for the validation of the StarfixNG software package before it is rolled out to the vessels. I got a lot of opportunities e.g. I joined a geotechnical project in Norway for one month which was great, I could design a validation cycle for the roll-out of the software package, and lately I am also preparing software training for workshop engineers and surveyors.
 

What do I enjoy in a job:
  •  International/multi-discipline work environment.
  •  Use of Agile-Scrum method for team work planning.
  •  Software and system integration.
  •  Exploratory aspect.
  •  Travel.

PERSONAL STRENGHTS:
  •  Promotor of efficient knowledge sharing with team members, local and abroad
  •  Curious and dedicated
  •  Open minded


SPECIALTIES: 
  •  Platforms: MS Windows, Ubuntu Linux.
  •  Tools: Fugro StarfixNG, Perforce, GIT, JIRA, Youtrack, HP Quality Centre, Selenium, Eclipse, ArcGIS, MS Project, SharePoint.
  •  Languages & Frameworks: Python, HTML, Lua, Robotium.
